text:
Hello everyone,
I want to create a workflow which call a rest api(with contact and it's updated owner email in post data) of any third party app whenever a contact owner of a contact is modified. Anyone have idea how to do it ?

Contact WF
Trigger = Owner is known / Re-enrolment activated
Action = custom code in which you do the call to your REST API

Beware, you need Operation Hub Pro or Enterprise to do so, and do not forget that custom codes are limited to 20s.

Does that answer your question ?

Also if you want to collect the owner’s email, you’ll have to add a call to HubSpot’s Owner API in a first custom code. NAtively HubSpot WF only give you the user ID of the owner, not their emails. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/reference/api/crm/owners#get-%2Fcrm%2Fv3%2Fowners%2F%7Bownerid%7D>

Hey Everyone!

Does anyone know if there is a way to assign user seats via API?
does anyone know if its possible to trigger a workflow on a call object being created? all I see is "call ended" "call started" which doesn't cover object being created for some reason

Hi <@U04N6N424MB>
Did you test something like this ?
(Call title or Call source or whatever property is better)
Does anyone know if Private App webhooks have been patched to not let you use a workflow webhook trigger url as the target url?

I have a workflow which is triggered when a particular property value of a contact is changed.After that a custom action we have sends contact data to our Shaachi gateway endpoint.
Our AI creates a personalized email message for that contact in a few minutes. It writes the message using 3 custom properties to HubSpot contact. We are trying to create a workflow rule that waits for the custom properties to be ready with the output. Then, it can proceed to the next action such as sending an email. For that we need to check any of the custom property periodically unit output is wriiten. How to do this repeated condition checking periodically?
